title: Youtube, no more Ads on a CPR video!

data.title: Youtube, no more Ads on a CPR video!
data.statement:
Oh no! A man is dying next to you, and needs CPR IMMEDIATELY! However, you do not know how to do CPR. No worries tho, this is the time of the internet! You opened up Youtube and searched for "How to do a CPR". However! You do not have Youtube Premium, and you have very bad WI-FI. You also have to watch the entire video to learn CPR, and with some magic powers, when you do the CPR it will immediately save the man. Figure out if you can learn CPR in time and save the man next to you, or does he get a ticket to heaven in the music of Youtube's Ad....

P.S. if the time for the man to live is equal to the time it takes for you to learn CPR, the man lives. For example, the man has 300 seconds to live, and it takes a total of 300 seconds, including ads and loading times, for you to finish the video, the man would still live.

testCases.title: Let him live!
testCases.testOut:
Stay on Earth
Ads are still annoying

testCases.testOut:

Ads kill

data.stubGenerator:
read time:int
read loadingTime:int
read video:int
read ads:int
loop ads read adLength:int skippable:int skipTime:int

write hopefully you have Youtube Premium!
data.inputDescription:
Please note all the below units for measuring <<time>> are in <<seconds>>
<<Line 1>>: An integer [[time]] -- the time the man next to you has to live(seconds)
<<Line 2>>: An integer [[loadingTime]] -- the video loading time
<<Line 3>>: An integer [[video]] -- the length of the video
<<Line 4>>:  An integer [[ads]] -- how many ads there are
<<Next [[ads]] lines>>:  {{3 space-separated integers}} [[adLength]] -- the length of that ad, [[skippable]] -- if that ad is skippable or not. {{0}} is false, {{1}} is true, [[skipTime]] -- the time when you can skip the ad if it's skippable. If it is not skippable, it will be {{-1}}
data.outputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: {{Stay on Earth}} if the man lived, and {{A ticket to Heaven}} if the man died.
<<Line 2>>: If the man died, add {{Ads kill}} if you can save the man in time if there was no ad, or {{I still hate ads}}. If the man lived, add {{Ads are still annoying}}.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Oh no! A man is dying next to you, and needs CPR IMMEDIATELY! However, you do not know how to do CPR. No worries tho, this is the time of the internet! You opened up Youtube and searched for "How to do a CPR". However! You do not have Youtube Premium, and you have very bad WI-FI. You also have to watch the entire video to learn CPR, and with some magic powers, when you do the CPR it will immediately save the man. Figure out if you can learn CPR in time and save the man next to you, or does he get a ticket to heaven in the music of Youtube's Ad....

P.S. if the time for the man to live is equal to the time it takes for you to learn CPR, the man lives. For example, the man has 300 seconds to live, and it takes a total of 300 seconds, including ads and loading times, for you to finish the video, the man would still live.
Input
Please note all the below units for measuring time are in seconds
Line 1: An integer time -- the time the man next to you has to live(seconds)
Line 2: An integer loadingTime -- the video loading time
Line 3: An integer video -- the length of the video
Line 4: An integer ads -- how many ads there are
Next ads lines: 3 space-separated integers adLength -- the length of that ad, skippable -- if that ad is skippable or not. 0 is false, 1 is true, skipTime -- the time when you can skip the ad if it's skippable. If it is not skippable, it will be -1
Output
Line 1: Stay on Earth if the man lived, and A ticket to Heaven if the man died.
Line 2: If the man died, add Ads kill if you can save the man in time if there was no ad, or I still hate ads. If the man lived, add Ads are still annoying.
Constraints
300 >= time >= 120
15 >= loadingTime >= 0
300 >= video >= 50
5 >= ads >=0
45 >= adLength >=5
30 >= skipTime >= 5
Example
Input
300
2
83
2
5 0 -1
30 1 15
Output
Stay on Earth
Ads are still annoying
